newsitem.title: USA: Software buys UK firm, sees FY 97 charge.
newsitem.headline: Software buys UK firm, sees FY 97 charge.

text.p: Software developer Software 2000 Inc said on Monday it aquired Time Open Systems Inc for $9 million and will record a charge of up to $0.25 a share in fiscal 1997 from the transaction.
Software 2000 president and chief executive Frederick Lizza said the charge will reflect the expansion of distibution channels for Time, a British software firm.

"(The charge will occur) because we will make significant incremental investments to build up the distrubution channels ...to sell the NT products without drawing away from the AS/400 product line," he told Reuters.
Time Open Systems' financial application software runs on the Microsoft Windows NT operating system. Software 2000 also sells client/server software that runs on the AS/400 platform.

According to First Call, the fiscal year 1997 Wall Street consensus earnings estimates for Software 2000 is $0.68 cents a share. For fiscal 1996 ending September 30, the firm reported earnings of $0.49 cents per share.
Lizza said they will immediately accelerate the marketing of Time's products in the U.K., with a U.S. and global launch due by June, after the programming is fitted to accept regional irregularities.
"While the product is internationalized, it doesn't have all the local nuances," he said. "For example, it understands value taxes, but it doesn't understand sales tax."
